sources.title: Crackerjack
sources.description: “Really rather charming” “Cracking entertainment” “Worth watching” “Starts well but tails off” (IMDB reviews quotes). Tongue-in-cheek British crime capers perpetrated by an unlikely Robin Hood played Tom Walls. Lilli Palmer costarrs. Good supporting cast and good production values. IMDB rating 6.7. Directed by Albert de Courville. Released in 1938. Complete print. A. K.A. “The Man with 100 Faces” (US).

metadata.Plot: When dwindling membership and increasing overheads makes a local bowling club and prime candidate for a takeover, it's all hands on deck to save the club, in what turns into an epic battle where young meets old, greed meets good and people rise to the occasion in extraordinary circumstances.
metadata.Actors: Mick Molloy, Bill Hunter, Frank Wilson
